name: Welcome Back, Development Opportunity Competitions, and Brainstorming

venue.name: Department of Computer Science, Mercer University

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description:
Welcome Back!!! We will discuss our plans for this semester. Two software development 'Contests' will be presented.  One contest is strictly for Mercer students, while the other is open to the community.

Space is limited.  We are setting a cap of 10 Meetup attendees so there will be room for Mercer students (who won't sign up here).  If this cap is reached, we will try to increase it.

name: Google Developers Study Jams Android for Beginners Udacity Course

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description:
We will spend four weeks on Google's and Udacity's Android Development for Beginners course. You should sign up for the free version of the Udacity course at: https://www.udacity.com/account/affiliate/GoogleStudyJams. Each week, prior to our meeting, you should work through a Udacity lesson. During our meetings we will discuss the lesson, answer questions about the lesson, share programming hints and tips, and play around with variations on the lesson. Here is our planned schedule:
Week 1: Udacity Lesson 1 (A and B)
Week 2: Udacity Lesson 2 (A and B)
Week 3: Udacity Lesson 3 (A and B)
Week 4: Udacity Final Project 5 Things.

Check out the official site: http://developerstudyjams.com/
(to be updated shortly)

Space is limited.  We have opened 10 spots for Meetup... many students will show up without registering at Meetup.  If more space is needed, we will try to find more room.

name: Intro to Unity Game Engine - preparing us to build apps for Google Cardboard

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description:
The already famous John Robison will be introducing us to the “Unity Game Engine.”  No experience required.  This introduction will be geared towards preparing us to build apps for Google Cardboard.   

March 16th will focus on Unity fundamentals.

March 23rd will focus on incorporating Unity onto the Cardboard.

Food and Fun, Too! Everyone is welcome.
how_to_find_us: We will be in building 13 on this map: http://about.mercer.edu/www/resources/upload/MaconCampusMapWEB.pdf

name: Intro to Unity Game Engine - preparing us to build apps for Google Cardboard

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description:

how_to_find_us: We will be in building 13 on this map: http://about.mercer.edu/www/resources/upload/MaconCampusMapWEB.pdf

name: Progressive Web Apps - an Introduction with Codelabs

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description: Google held a Progressive Web App Dev Summit in Amsterdam on June 20-21, 2016. We will view some key talks from that event, and then walk you through a codelab or two. We will have our lab computers set up for the labs, but you might want to bring your laptop.

name: Introduction to Google's Firebase (and how it will be used in upcoming DevFest)

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description:
Firebase's primary product is a realtime database which provides an API that allows developers to store and sync data across multiple clients. - Wikipedia

We will see a really cool application of Firebase in a real-time, online, game.  We will then play around with the concept of Mercer’s upcoming DevFest - to be held on October 22, 2016.

name: DevFest 2016: A Festival for artists, software developers, and creative thinkers

venue.name: Mercer University, Science and Engineering Building

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description:
Crowd-Sourced Art: Middle Georgia’s first DevFest will introduce Google’s Firebase, a cloud database, show how it easily interacts with multiple devices at the same time, and then form teams of artists and coders to begin creating a shared graphics canvas.

9am: Doors Open

10am: Keynote Address

11am: Introduction to Firebase - Google's Cloud Database

12 noon:  Lunch (provided to first 50 participants)

1pm: Introduction to the collaborative art project

Hack and create until.....

4pm:  Present our digital art (and play around with it)

Check out the official website, and register there: http://devfest.cs.mercer.edu/ 

You will want to bring your laptop.

name: Introduction to Google's Street View API - via JavaScript

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description: We will play around with Google's Street View API.  Once we get our API Key setup, it is easy to add Street Views to your webpage.  We will walk through this process, create a simple webpage with a Street View, and then brainstorm on apps we could build to use this technology.
how_to_find_us: We are back in the Computer Science Building (not the Engineering Auditorium)

name: Humans vs Zombies - Let's make a phone app!

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description: How could a phone app help while playing HvZ? We need to hear your thoughts and ideas. GDG will brainstorm (brainlessstorm) on how to build this app. We can do this as a Progressive Web App!

name: Google Cloud Next viewing Party - Part One

venue.name: Department of Computer Science, Mercer University

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description:
Google is hosting their largest Cloud Technologies conference ever in San Francisco March 8-10, 2017: Google Cloud Next.  Most of us will not be able to attend, however, we are very interested in learning many of these technologies. 

We will use this meetup to capture some of the enthusiasm generated at Cloud Next.  First we will watch the Keynote address from the conference.  Then we will look over the conference sessions and code labs.   Finally, we will pick one or more code labs to do at a followup MeetUp (March 29th).

Google will be providing pizza and drinks for our party.  Thanks Google!

Here is a list of the major topics being promoted at Cloud Next:

• Big Data and Machine Learning

• Application Development

• Infrastructure and Operations

• Collaboration and Productivity

• Mobility and Devices
how_to_find_us: Enter Mercer's campus on College Street on the north side of campus.  We are the third building on the right.

name: Google Cloud Next viewing Party - Part Two

venue.name: Department of Computer Science, Mercer University

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description:
While this meetup is a continuation of our meetup two weeks ago (https://www.meetup.com/Mercer-University-Google-Developers-Group-Meetup/events/237228680/), you can easily attend this party without having attended part one. :) We will play around with one or more of the Code Labs from Google's Cloud Next conference. Bring your laptop, or we'll have a desktop for you to use.

Google will be providing Pizza again for this party. Thanks Google!!

name: Introduction to Angular

venue.name: Department of Computer Science, Mercer University

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description:
Our very own John Robison will give us an introduction to Google's Angular JS framework.  No experience is needed.  We will have computers to use during this talk/workshop, but you may prefer to bring your own laptop to play along.  I'll be serving some snacks during the talk.

Google's Website states:

Why AngularJS?

HTML is great for declaring static documents, but it falters when we try to use it for declaring dynamic views in web-applications. AngularJS lets you extend HTML vocabulary for your application. The resulting environment is extraordinarily expressive, readable, and quick to develop.

We will follow this talk up in two weeks with more Angular and interactions with Google's Firebase!

Looking forward to seeing you.

name: Angular Development with Firebase

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description:
John Robison will continue the workshop on Google's Angular JS framework. No experience is needed, and please feel free to join us even if you missed the first presentation.  We will have computer to use during this workshop, however, you may prefer to bring your own laptop to play along.  I'll be serving some snacks.

This week John will show us how we can make our website pull data from Google's cloud database: Firebase.  This will be fun, and so powerful!

I am looking forward to seeing you, and playing in the clouds!!

-Bob Allen

name: Introduction to Google Actions

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description: “Actions on Google let you build for the Google Assistant. Your integrations can help you engage users through Google Home today, and in the future, through Pixel, Allo, and many other experiences where the Google Assistant will be available.” - Google

name: Google Home Automation and Christmas Party

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description: We are going to play around with some Google Home automation.  First we will demonstrate how your voice can control various things in your house.  Then we will experiment and brainstorm on future projects.  Finally, thanks to Google, we will have a random drawing for some great door prizes!

name: Southeast Startup Challenge by Spark Macon, GDG, and others.

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description:
• What we'll do
The Southeast Startup Challenge is a 5 city hackathon for entrepreneurs. We’ve done the hard work of finding critical partners and first customers that have identified specific problems they believe that technology startups can solve.

Midsize cities have distinct differences from large cities which provide a unique opportunity for entrepreneurs to innovate from a different perspective. 40% of the nation lives in mid and small size communities, which provides a huge and mostly untapped market for companies to grow.

Join the Southeast Startup Challenge and you could finish the weekend with your first customer, and an invite to pitch in June for over $25,000 in cash and services to help your business grow!

Register NOW and join us for a phenomenal experience, an opportunity to serve a great cause, and win some money.

• What to bring
Laptop and development tools/references.

• Important to know
Free event sponsored by GDG, Spark Macon, and others. Please register at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/southeast-startup-challenge-tickets-43836282501

name: Build Actions for your Community - Introduction and Codelabs

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description:
• What we'll do
This is the first of a 3 part series dedicated to the development of Actions on Google Assistant for the community. This first meeting will introduce the Google Actions technology, and the tools used to develop custom conversations. We will then work through a Codelab provided by Google. One goal for this meeting is to inspire you to develop your own community based Google Action. We will discuss, and brainstorm, possible actions to build during the next few weeks.

• What to bring
You may want to bring your laptop, so you can easily continue your work at home. We will have PCs available for use.

• Important to know

name: Build Actions for your Community - Mini Hack-a-thon

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description:
• What we'll do
This is the second in a three part series. This week we will work together to build our Actions on Google. Teams, or individuals, will spend this time brainstorming, and coding their actions. We will use this time together to answer each others questions, bounce ideas off each other, and to test our work.

• What to bring
You may want to bring your laptop. We will have PCs available for use.

• Important to know

name: Build Actions for your Community - Demonstrations and Celebrations

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description:
• What we'll do
This is the third in a series dealing with Google Actions. Tonight we will show off our creations and celebrate our accomplishments. We will also use this time to give each other constructive commentary on our Actions, and make plans for future improvements.

• What to bring
You may want to bring your laptop. We will have PCs available.

• Important to know

name: Women Techmakers - An Introduction

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description:
Mercer's GDG was awarded a Women Techmakers chapter earlier this year. We are now ready to make our introduction to the community.
Google's Women Techmaker groups foster visibility, community and resources for women in technology.
During this meeting we will share our vision of providing a space for women to meet and share success stories. Mercer's Women Techmakers will also provide a platform for women to present technical topics and passions.
Our inaugural presentation will feature a presentation by Cynthia Robertson, our Women Techmaker leader. She will report on her experiences while attending the Grace Hopper Celebration (GHC) in Houston, TX. GHC is the largest technical conference for women in computing.
Come celebrate with us the power of women!

Note: Men are welcome to attend this meeting.
how_to_find_us: Enter campus on College Street, from the north, and there is a small parking lot next to our building.  If it is full, you should try to park around Tattnall Park.

name: AR Scavenger Hunt at Open Streets Macon - A warm up exercise for next month!

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description: Augmented Reality Scavenger Hunt - during Open Streets event in Macon. This event will wet our appetites for writing our own AR next month at GDG Mercer University. Check out this link for more details: https://www.facebook.com/events/493864294425750/permalink/496039184208261/
how_to_find_us: Look for the tent on the sidewalk.

name: Augmented Reality Workshop - Google ARCore DevFest 2018

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description:
This is a two part event. On the first night, November 28, 2018, we will play around with Google's ARCore, their Augmented Reality platform, and some Unity. We will learn about the capabilities in ARCore, and then walk through a Google Code Lab for ARCore. Finally, the rules of our AR Contest will be revealed during this first evening.

Dinner will be provided, and T-Shirts will be handed out to the first 30 people in attendance.

Participants will then have a week to build an AR experience to bring back for this competition.

Part two of this MeetUp takes place on Wednesday, December 5, 2018, at 6pm. We will quickly review ARCore and its capabilities, and then spend most of our time demonstrating and playing with each other's ARs. This event will end by voting for the winners of the contest, and handing out the prizes: a Google Hub, a Google Home Mini, and a Chromecast.

Dinner will be provided.
how_to_find_us: We will be in Lab 100, on the ground floor of the Computer Science Building on Mercer's Macon campus.

name: Augmented Reality Workshop (Part 2) - Google ARCore DevFest 2018

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description:
This is a two part event. On the first night, November 28, 2018, we will play around with Google's ARCore, their Augmented Reality platform, and some Unity. We will learn about the capabilities in ARCore, and then walk through a Google Code Lab for ARCore. Finally, the rules of our AR Contest will be revealed during this first evening.

Dinner will be provided, and T-Shirts will be handed out to the first 30 people in attendance.

Participants will then have a week to build an AR experience to bring back for this competition.

Part two of this MeetUp takes place on Wednesday, December 5, 2018, at 6pm. We will quickly review ARCore and its capabilities, and then spend most of our time demonstrating and playing with each other's ARs. This event will end by voting for the winners of the contest, and handing out the prizes: a Google Hub, a Google Home Mini, and a Chromecast.

Dinner will be provided.
how_to_find_us: We will be in Lab 100, on the ground floor of the Computer Science Building on Mercer's Macon campus.

name: Women Techmakers - LBA Ware Founder Presents

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description: CEO and Founder of LBA Ware, Lori Brewer, will help celebrate International Women's Day as she describes how she built a successful software development company. LBA Ware is driving innovation in mortgage lending and banking operations. LBA Ware promotes creativity, innovation, and problem solving with technologies like SQL Server, ASP.Net, JQuery, C#, and VB. Come help us celebrate Women in Technology on International Women's Day! Food and Fun for all! Everyone is welcome! #IWD

name: Kubernetes in the Google Cloud

group.name: Mercer University Google Developers Group Meetup

description:
A special thanks to GDG member Matthew Orahood, for volunteering to lead this meeting. Thanks! If any other members would like to present topics at a GDG meeting, we can make that happen.

Kubernetes is the most popular container orchestration system and it was designed specifically with Google Cloud Platform integration in mind. We will begin with an overview of Kubernetes and how to use Google's QwikLabs. We will then provide free credits to Google's QwikLabs and get you started working through the following two labs:

1. Introduction to Docker
In this lab you will familiarize yourself with the basic Docker container environment commands. You will create, run, and debug containers, and learn to pull and push images to and from Google Container Registry.

2. Hello Node Kubernetes
In this hands-on lab, you turn your code into a replicated application running on Kubernetes. You create a Node.js app, create a Docker container from it, deploy it to Kubernetes Engine, and scale it up. Watch a short preview Hello Node Kubernetes, GCP Essentials.
